value.title: Power BI Tutorial | From Flat File To Data Model
value.excerpt: In this Power BI Tutorial, Patrick looks at how to load data from a flat file to the data model. This could be a text, csv or excel file with a lot of columns. Don't just pull it into Power BI. Take time to structure your data in your data model. From flat file to data model is basic concept, but is
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/vjBprojOCzU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Publish/Migrate your RDL files from Power BI Report Server to the service

value.title: RLS with TWO Fact tables in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you struggled with using Row-Level Security (RLS) on a dimension connected to two fact tables? value.title: Storytelling with Power BI and PowerPoint
value.excerpt: Give up those static images of your reports in PowerPoint! Learn how to integrate your Power BI report to help tell your story directly within PowerPoint!  Tell a story with your data. value.title: ALL vs ALLSelected in Power BI and DAX
value.excerpt: These two functions in DAX are often used instead of each other; ALL and ALLSELECTED. Their behavior can be similar in some contexts, but it can also be different in other contexts. In this article and video, I'll explain the difference between these two functions and when to use each in DAX for Power

value.title: Get a field value from a related table in Power BI DAX RELATED Function Explained
value.excerpt: Sometimes, in Power BI, you need to access a field’s value from another table that somehow is related to the existing table. You can use Power Query transformations such as combining Merge with something else. However, this can be needed when you write a DAX expression too. In this article and video,

However, there is a simple way to hide or lock it from the user. In this article and video, I explain how that works. Read

value.title: Replace BLANK with Zero in Power BI Visuals Such as Card
value.excerpt: If you use a field in a visual and based on a combination of slicer selection, that field doesn't have any value, you might see blank in the visual. value.title: Row Filtering in Power BI and Power Query   Remove Blank Rows Vs Remove Empty
value.excerpt: When you have blank values in your data table, you can use Power Query transformations to remove the row with blank values. value.title: Sentiment Colors for Gauge Visual in Power BI
value.excerpt: Gauge Visual is a great visual for KPIs, however, the Gauge visual in Power BI doesn’t have the sentiment colors as an option.
